I always change trains and arrive late and have to take a taxi. Students have to go back and forth twice a day to study. Although student tickets are cheaper, it always brings a lot of inconvenience. is it? It’s about 16 and above but not 13~14 and above. Many people just walk to school. They have to walk when changing trains, walk or ride a bicycle to the station.
titleEN: Over 16 years old open motorcycle driver's license (excluding heavy machinery)

title: 癌症免疫新藥預算要超前部署、編列充足，讓「免疫新藥給付放寬」是看得到的未來、及癌症病患盼得到的希望！
proposal: 發起背景 癌症免疫新藥（癌症免疫檢查點抑制劑）是新型癌症治療方法，機轉為透過藥物增強人體免疫系統識別癌細胞的能力，讓免疫細胞有效攻擊癌細胞，進而達到消滅癌灶或抑制擴散之目的。 相較起傳統療法，在療程中對人體造成的負擔與損傷較低。然正因癌症免疫新藥是激發癌症病患的自身免疫系統發揮作用，若患者自身免疫系統存在缺陷或過晚投藥，已然不佳的身體條件就難以發揮預期的臨床效果。 民國108年起，癌症免疫新藥獲健保核准8個癌別、11個適應症納入給付，受到廣大國人肯定；然而根據健保署統計，在目前預算限制下，實際核准使用人數僅不到2,000人（截至109年3月計1,838人），意即在全部核准適應症的癌症病患當中，只有不到10%的幸運兒有機會使用此療法。 人生而無法選擇會否罹病，更無法預知會罹患哪種癌症，縱使再努力維持健康，重大疾病仍可能無情發生於你我或至親身上。而全民健保之立意即在實踐風險分擔、社會互助的「社會保險」制度。這項制度存在的珍貴價值，就是當重大疾病發生時，暫且不論會否因病而貧，至少在延命這個最小願望前，病患能保有選擇最佳治療方法的機會與權利。 隨著癌症時鐘不斷快轉、國人罹癌比率日益昇高、癌症病患人數不斷增加，若癌症免疫新藥預算編列始終遠低於當前需求，難免漸有悖離照護國人健康初衷之虞。明年度的健保新藥預算審核在即，我們必須正面檢視癌症免疫新藥預算之困境，以確保現在與未來癌症病患的用藥權益。  三大訴求 一、新適應症持續增加，新藥及新適應症預算應超前部署二、不合理的給付條件應修正，給癌症病患更高的醫療品質與存活希望三、佈局合併療法，為國人謀求長遠穩健的醫療選擇權
benefits&impact:
一、確實保障現在和未來符合適應症的癌症病患擁有選擇接受免疫新藥治療的權利 
癌症免疫藥物具有單一藥物可投藥於多種癌症之特性，眼看著食藥署核准之適應症與癌別不斷增加，卻因預算規劃不足而無法照顧每位符合適應症條件之癌症病患。今年初健保署更以預算不足為由，在免疫新藥給付剛屆滿一年，即取消原已核定的部分適應症的給付，讓仍在等待機會接受免疫藥物治療的癌症病患頓失希望。若健保署持續維持相同預算，下一個被奪走生存希望的難保不會是你我或身旁摯愛。 建議健保署應針對每年新增的癌症免疫新藥及新適應症，提早做預算的規劃，以避免下一個憾事再次發生。 
  
二、保護有機會接受治療的癌症病患，不因不合理的篩選條件而延誤治療，或甚至被拒於治療門外 
現行癌症免疫藥物設下極嚴格的資格審查，甚至包括許多不合理的篩選條件。舉例來說，原本應該在二線就能使用的晚期腎細胞癌，卻被放到三線才能使用；這樣的限制可能會讓癌症病患因延誤接受免疫藥物治療而無法達到預期的臨床效果，而且也跟當初食藥署核准的仿單內容相違背。建議健保署應遵循食藥署所核准的仿單適應症內容來訂定健保給付條件。 
  
三、佈局合併療法，為國人謀求長遠穩健的醫療選擇權利，成為國人深所信賴、真心託付的社會保險制度 
最新的多項醫療臨床研究顯示，雙免疫藥物合併療法或免疫藥物合併標靶藥物治療，能夠達成更高的治療反應率並延長整體存活時間，食藥署也陸續核准合併治療的新適應症。免疫藥物合併療法已是未來可預期的國際癌症治療趨勢，台灣身為先進醫療之典範，全民健保也應與時俱進、著眼長久且穩健的制度，為國人謀求最佳醫療選擇權利，成為國人深所信賴、真心託付的社會保險制度。
proposer: 年輕病友社群 我們都有病
proposalEN: Launch background Cancer immune new drug (cancer immune checkpoint inhibitor) is a new type of cancer treatment. The mechanism is to use drugs to enhance the ability of the human immune system to recognize cancer cells, so that immune cells can effectively attack cancer cells, thereby achieving the purpose of eliminating cancer focus or inhibiting its spread. Compared with traditional therapy, the burden and damage to the human body during the course of treatment are lower. However, because new cancer immune drugs stimulate the immune system of cancer patients to play a role, if the patient's own immune system is deficient or the drug is administered too late, it is difficult for the patient's poor physical condition to exert the expected clinical effect. Since the 2010 Republic of China, new cancer immune drugs have been approved by the National Health Insurance for 8 cancer types and 11 indications to be covered, which has been recognized by the majority of Chinese people. However, according to the statistics of the National Health Insurance Administration, under the current budget constraints, the actual number of approved users is only less than 2,000 (1,838 as of March 2019), which means that among all cancer patients with approved indications, less than 10% of the lucky ones have the opportunity to use this therapy. People are born unable to choose whether they will get sick, let alone predict what kind of cancer they will get. No matter how hard they try to maintain their health, major diseases may still happen to you, me or your loved ones mercilessly. The idea of ​​national health insurance is to practice the "social insurance" system of risk sharing and social mutual assistance. The precious value of this system is that when a major disease occurs, patients can retain the opportunity and right to choose the best treatment method, regardless of whether they will be impoverished due to the disease or not, at least before the minimum wish of prolonging life. As the cancer clock continues to turn fast, the rate of cancer in the Chinese population is increasing, and the number of cancer patients is increasing, if the budget for new cancer immune drugs is always far below the current demand, it will inevitably go against the original intention of caring for the health of the Chinese people. Next year's health insurance new drug budget review is coming soon. We must positively review the plight of the cancer immune new drug budget to ensure the drug rights and interests of cancer patients now and in the future. Three major demands 1. New indications continue to increase, and the budget for new drugs and new indications should be deployed in advance. 2. Unreasonable payment conditions should be revised to give cancer patients higher medical quality and survival hope.
titleEN: The budget for new cancer immune drugs should be deployed ahead of time and be adequately prepared. The "relaxation of payment for new immune drugs" is the foreseeable future and the hope that cancer patients hope for!

title: 調降大麻及其相類製品的毒品分級，並調整大麻製品中四氫大麻酚（THC）含量的容許值以符國際標準
proposal: 大麻在台灣目前被列為二級毒品，被認為是1種具有強烈成癮性，使用後會對生理機能、心理及認知能力造成嚴重的傷害，且毫無醫療價值的毒品。管制範圍依《毒品危害防制條例》及其附表二，包含大麻、大麻脂、大麻浸膏、大麻酊、六氫大麻酚及四氫大麻酚。  但國外研究顯示，大麻不論在成癮性、濫用性或社會危害性上皆屬輕微，世界衛生組織（WHO）也在2019年提出1961年《麻醉品單一公約》的修改建議，建議重新歸類大麻的藥物分級，從「具有特別危險性」，並且「特別容易被濫用並產生不良影響」的第4級藥物，改為「應進行醫學和科學的分析，並根據其功能安排社會效用」的第1級藥物。  鄰近亞洲國家，日本、韓國、泰國都已將大麻不同程度的開放，作為醫療使用或食品、化妝品的添加物，我國衛福部也於今年5月7號在提點子【開放醫療用大麻】的提案中正面肯定大麻的醫療價值。  另外我國對大麻的管制雖然不包括大麻成熟莖（Hemp）及種子所製成的製品，但限制其中四氫大麻酚的含量不得超過10ppm（0.00001%），否則也會被認定為二級毒品。  參照美國2018年《大麻農業法》通過的標準，四氫大麻酚含量在0.3%以下的大麻製品，不會產生精神活性，因此不會被當作毒品來管制，此項標準以長久累積的科學證據為基礎，同時也是現今的國際標準，反觀台灣過於嚴苛的標準，國外認定沒問題的大麻製品，帶回台灣卻變成毒品，造成許多人無辜受罰。  綜上所述，建請法務部提案修改《毒品危害防制條例》及其附表，調降大麻及其相類製品的毒品分級，並修改附表中大麻成熟莖及種子所製成之製品中，四氫大麻酚含量的容許值，以符合國際標準與保障人民權益。
benefits&impact:
1、切合國際趨勢 
2、減輕執法負擔 
3、紓解法院訟源 
4、提升人權保障 
5、扶助農業發展
proposalEN: Marijuana is currently listed as a second-class drug in Taiwan. It is considered to be a highly addictive drug that can cause serious damage to physiological functions, psychology, and cognitive abilities after use, and has no medical value. The scope of control is in accordance with the "Drug Harm Prevention Regulations" and its Schedule II, including cannabis, cannabis resin, cannabis extract, cannabis tincture, hexahydrocannabinol and tetrahydrocannabinol. However, foreign studies have shown that marijuana is mild in terms of addiction, abuse or social harm. The World Health Organization (WHO) also proposed in 2019 a revision of the 1961 "Single Convention on Narcotic Drugs", suggesting that the drug classification of marijuana should be reclassified. Neighboring Asian countries, Japan, South Korea, and Thailand have all opened up cannabis to varying degrees, as medical use or as an additive to food and cosmetics. The Ministry of Health and Welfare of my country also positively affirmed the medical value of cannabis in the proposal [open medical cannabis] on May 7 this year. In addition, although my country's control of cannabis does not include products made from hemp mature stems (Hemp) and seeds, the content of THC in them is limited to no more than 10ppm (0.00001%), otherwise it will also be identified as a secondary drug. With reference to the standards adopted by the United States’ Hemp Farming Act in 2018, cannabis products with a THC content of less than 0.3% will not produce psychoactive effects, and therefore will not be regulated as drugs. This standard is based on long-term accumulated scientific evidence and is also the current international standard. In contrast, Taiwan’s standards are too strict. Cannabis products that are considered good by foreign countries are brought back to Taiwan but turned into drugs, causing many innocent people to be punished. To sum up, I suggest that the Ministry of Justice propose to amend the "Regulations on the Prevention and Control of Narcotic Hazards" and its attached schedule, lower the drug classification of marijuana and its similar products, and revise the allowable value of THC content in products made from mature cannabis stems and seeds in the attached schedule, so as to meet international standards and protect people's rights and interests.
titleEN: Downgrade the drug classification of cannabis and its similar products, and adjust the allowable value of tetrahydrocannabinol (THC) content in cannabis products to meet international standards

title: 廢除道路交通管理處罰條例第7條之1規定(民眾得敘明違規事實或檢具違規證據資料檢舉)
proposal: 人民有免於恐懼的自由，不是每天開車、騎車要擔心受怕，不知道何時會遭到檢舉達人檢舉，況且人民並不是執法者，不能以當事人違規為由就無限上綱讓人民來充當執法者來檢舉開單，而且徒增警察業務。
benefits&impact: 人民財產會受到莫名減少，且警察義務量暴增，影響見警率。
proposalEN: The people have the freedom from fear. They don’t have to worry about driving and cycling every day. They don’t know when they will be reported by experts. Moreover, the people are not law enforcement officers. They cannot use the party’s violations as an excuse to let the people act as law enforcement officers to report and issue bills. This will only increase the business of the police.
titleEN: Repeal Article 7-1 of the Road Traffic Management Punishment Regulations (the public may state the facts of violations or provide evidence and materials of violations to report)

title: 要求108新課綱高中課程移除學習歷程檔案一項
proposal: 1.學習歷程檔案的不必要性:在高中生活裡，學業範圍加深加廣，學生在兼顧課業之餘，實在難有時間再去參與其他課外的活動，除此之外，教育部原先的理念為不應該只透過成績來評斷一個學生的能力，應該透過更多元、全面的面向來參照，但在學測結束到推甄之前，這短短的時間裡是很難生出能超越水準以上的歷程檔案的，所以學生往往得從高一時就開始準備，而有些科系不太參照學系領域以外的歷程檔案，這也意味著學生三年的努力可能白費，而且也並不是每位學生都在高一就決定好自己未來想就讀的科系及就業方向，所以學習歷程不是升學的助力，反而是阻力。 2.學習歷程檔案的可信度:前面提到教育部的理念為希望透過成績以外資料參照一個學生的能力在哪裡，但是就我身邊的同學老師及許多同為108課綱的學生來看，學習歷程最重要的目的，好像不再是學習許多課堂中學不到的知識，以充實自己，而是變成一個上大學前要做好的作業，覺得只是交差了事罷了，彷彿就像是在比誰寫的故事比較精彩一樣，所以跟學業成績比起來，這些似乎更不能清楚了解學生的能力。 因此，綜合以上兩點，我認為108新課綱中，學習歷程不是必需的，而且優點不明顯多於缺點，所以我主張移除此項目。
benefits&impact: 在移除學習歷程檔案後，我認為學生能更專注在課程的學習上，而不是需要一直擔心沒東西能上傳而窮擔心，也能去探索更多自己喜歡而且跨領域的東西，不再帶著壓力去學習新的事物，能更自由自在地度過高中生活。
proposalEN: 1. The need for learning history files: In high school life, the academic scope is deepened and broadened. It is difficult for students to have time to participate in other extracurricular activities. In addition, the original philosophy of the Ministry of Education is that a student’s ability should not be judged only by grades, but by more diverse and comprehensive aspects. The department does not refer to the history files outside the department, which also means that the students’ three years of hard work may be in vain, and not every student decides on the department and career direction they want to study in the first year of senior high school, so the learning process is not a help for further studies, but a hindrance. 2. Credibility of learning history files: As mentioned earlier, the Ministry of Education’s idea is to refer to a student’s ability through information other than grades. However, from the perspective of my classmates and teachers and many students who are also in the 108 curriculum, the most important purpose of the learning process is no longer to learn many knowledge that cannot be learned in the classroom to enrich themselves, but to become a homework that needs to be done before going to university. ability. Therefore, based on the above two points, I think that in the 108 new curriculum, the learning process is not necessary, and the advantages do not obviously outweigh the disadvantages, so I propose to remove this item.
titleEN: 108 New Curriculum High School Curriculum Requirement to Remove One Item of Learning History File

title: 政府應研擬政策在教育實習上給予學生實習補助津貼
proposal: 提議內容： 政府應擬訂政策給予實習學生補助津貼（以下稱為津貼），讓學生能更專心的在實習課程上。 發起背景 立法院於民國九十二年修正師資培育法，其中教育實習由一年縮短為半年，並取消教育部補助每月新台幣八千元津貼，除須繳納四學分的學分費，學生身份也由「實習老師」改為「實習學生」。 以下分為四點分述之： 第一：教育實習本身具工作性質 法令規定學生須先通過教師資格考，而後銜接教育實習，學生在學期間已有實習課程及通過資格考的背景下，皆具備相對應的基礎知識與能力。實習內容包含上台授課（每週至少超過基本教學節數六分之一）、支援各處室與校內行政庶務等，且上下班時間比照正式老師，可知教育實習具備工作性質，對比其他考照執業如律師、醫師等，實習期間也都有薪資。 第二：教育實習費用及成本高 根據法令規定，每個月學生需要回原大學與指導教授開座談會。因在原大學附近租房及生活的成本通常較高，部分學生會因戶籍地的關係，選擇靠近家裡的學校，所以可能會有當日、多日往返北高此類之情形。在政府沒有津貼之下，另須負擔學分費、交通費、住宿費對於部分學生難以負荷。 第三：因法規規定及時間考量下，難以額外打工 在校實習時間約為早上8點至下午5點，有時候會有加班的需求（如班親會、開學典禮），若下班後額外打工將降低學習及教學品質，壓縮實習學生備課及準備教材的時間。 實習法規第27條有提供學生能在學校代課或是課輔的機會，但代課機會較少且規定為3個月內之代課；另外實習學生專長項目的不同（如音樂科、家政科），並非所有人皆適合進行專門科目上的課輔。 第四：給予實習學生津貼，能使實習學生更加專注 根據我們回收的32個意見調查（可參考附加檔案1），大部分認為給予實習學生津貼，可使實習學生減緩經濟壓力，上班時更加專注於教育實習上，下班時也有餘裕時間能充分地備課、準備教材。  綜合上述，我們認為給予實習補助津貼不只具備經濟層面、勞動層面上的正當性，在情意層面更能提升實習學生的學習動機，進一步轉化為實習成果，與未來正式師資的品質。 透過津貼，也有助於減少師資培育中經濟條件的限制，進而促進階級流動，即使貧困家庭的子女(*註1)，仍可以擁有平等的機會。實習津貼推行成功，未來在制定或改善相關政策上，更能建立政府與人民良好溝通的基石。   *註1：部分家庭情況不適用於「補助清寒實習學生助學金」
benefits&impact:
一、保障實習學生基礎生活，使上台教學品質更佳 
對於實習學生在此半年的負擔較不為沉重，不用在辦公時間外另尋額外的打工，並能更專心的在實習的課程準備上。 
二、佔教育部年度預算不到1% 
以109年~105年的教檢通過人數及109年教育部師資培育與藝術教育行政及督導來計算每個月進行4000元補助款，會佔預算約7%；而佔整體教育部預算比例不到1%（0.00089），總花費平均約為114,900千元。（*註2）  
  
*註2：計算方式為 當年度通過教檢人數*補助金額*6個月＝實習學生補助津貼總額（實習學生補助津貼總額）/（實習學生補助津貼總額＋109年該預算金額）＝佔該預算比例 
（詳細計算資料可參考下方附加檔案2）
proposalEN: Proposal content: The government should formulate a policy to give subsidy to intern students (hereinafter referred to as subsidy), so that students can concentrate more on the internship course. Initiation Background The Legislative Yuan amended the Teacher Training Law in 1992, which shortened the educational practice from one year to half a year, and canceled the NT$8,000 monthly subsidy from the Ministry of Education. In addition to paying the credit fee of four credits, the status of students was also changed from "trainee teacher" to "practice student". The following is divided into four points: First: Educational practice itself has a working nature. The law stipulates that students must first pass the teacher qualification examination, and then connect to educational practice. Students have already had internship courses during their studies and have passed the qualification examination. Under the background, they all have the corresponding basic knowledge and ability. The internship content includes teaching on stage (at least more than one-sixth of the basic teaching sessions per week), supporting various departments and school administrative affairs, etc., and the commuting time is compared with that of formal teachers. It can be seen that the educational internship has a working nature. Compared with other licensed practitioners such as lawyers and doctors, there are also salaries during the internship. Second: Educational practice fees and costs are high According to the law, students need to go back to the original university every month to have a seminar with the supervisor. Because the cost of renting a house and living near the original university is usually high, some students will choose a school close to their home due to the place of residence, so there may be situations such as commuting to and from Beigao on the same day or for multiple days. In the absence of government subsidies, credit fees, transportation fees, and accommodation fees have to be borne, which is difficult for some students. Third: Due to regulations and time considerations, it is difficult to work extra. The internship time in school is about 8:00 am to 5:00 pm. Sometimes there is a need to work overtime (such as family meetings, opening ceremonies). If you work extra after work, it will reduce the quality of learning and teaching, and shorten the time for intern students to prepare lessons and prepare textbooks. Article 27 of the Internship Regulations provides students with the opportunity to substitute or provide supplementary lessons at school, but there are few opportunities for substitute teaching and it is stipulated that they can substitute within 3 months; in addition, depending on the specialties of the intern students (such as music, home economics), not all students are suitable for supplementary courses in specialized subjects. Fourth: Giving intern students allowances can make intern students more focused. According to the survey of 32 opinions we collected (refer to attached file 1), most of them believe that granting intern student allowances can relieve the financial pressure of intern students. Based on the above, we believe that granting internship subsidies is not only justified on the economic and labor levels, but also can improve the learning motivation of intern students on the emotional level, which can be further transformed into internship results and the quality of future formal teachers. Through subsidies, it also helps to reduce the restrictions of economic conditions in teacher training, thereby promoting class mobility, and even children from poor families (*Note 1) can still have equal opportunities. The successful implementation of the internship subsidy will further establish the cornerstone of good communication between the government and the people in formulating or improving relevant policies in the future. *Note 1: Some family situations are not applicable to the "Subsidy for Underprivileged Internship Students"
titleEN: The government should formulate a policy to give students internship subsidies and subsidies for educational internships

title: 支持自體免疫疾病患者維持重大傷病免部分負擔保障
proposal: 中華民國類風濕性關節炎之友協會、中華民國思樂醫之友協會與台灣硬皮病友關懷協會攜手共同發起《支持自體免疫疾病患者維持重大傷病免部分負擔保障》提案，希望幫助患者們能夠持續安心就醫，不再擔心懼怕病魔的侵襲！
benefits&impact:
因衛福部/健保署研議《針對重大傷病患者取消免部分負擔的保障》，此將造成自體免疫疾病(類風濕性關節炎、全身性紅斑性狼瘡、乾燥症、全身性硬化症等)12萬患者與家庭重大衝擊。影響包括： 
1.自體免疫疾病需終身追蹤、治療，若不按時回診或住院，可能會導致病情惡化、殘障甚至生命危險。，增加未來的照顧成本與支出，毀損個人及家庭功能。 
2.自體免疫疾病的併發症眾多，需要同時看很多科例如另需就診骨科、眼科、腎臟科、皮膚科、心臟內科、胸腔科等，高就醫次數，加上住院次數多、住的久，用的藥費多、檢查多，且病況需於醫學中心、區域醫院，這些費用負擔更重的醫院接受專科治療，，整體花費龐大。 
3.重大傷病不等於身心障礙，但自體免疫疾病患者在發病時形同失能狀態，無法工作、從事生活自理，卻無法領受身心障礙身分同等的社會福利與服務，需要其他資源介入與社會援手的時候處處碰壁。若再取消重大傷病身分，連急難救助(因家人罹患重大傷病而生活困難：需要一個月以上的治療或療養、或取得重大傷病卡，而無法工作)與民間資源都難以申請。 
沒有人願意生病受苦，現階段全民健保的給付對自體疾病患者本就不足，昂貴藥品已是有條件式給付：如類風濕性關節炎的生物製劑與紅斑性狼瘡的MMF。我們冀盼謀劃國民健康保健的眼光是長遠且進步的，而非只顧及眼前所見，無視未來的潛在風險，以及保障取消後對整體社會帶來的嚴重傷害。
proposalEN: The Friends of Rheumatoid Arthritis Association of the Republic of China, the Friends of Sile Medical Association of the Republic of China, and the Taiwan Scleroderma Patient Care Association jointly launched the proposal "Supporting Autoimmune Disease Patients to Maintain Major Injury and Illness Partial Burden Protection", hoping to help patients continue to seek medical treatment with peace of mind and no longer worry about the fear of serious diseases!
titleEN: Supporting patients with autoimmune diseases to maintain partial coverage against major injury and illness

title: 車輛定期檢驗方式46年不變，積非成是，檢驗員自由心證！
proposal: 近年來戶外休閒活動盛行，自小客車、休旅車、吉普車、貨卡等，車輛依『道路交通安全規則』附件15之規定辦理小型汽車固定式置放架變更完成，但於定期檢驗時卻須將已辦理變更並註記之置放架上物品(例如：車頂帳篷、行李箱(盤)、伸縮式遮陽簾等)須拆除始能檢驗，其依據竟為交通部路政司63年7月30日第五次公路監理座談會第30項商定事項函，車輛檢驗應以空車為準，不得裝載鐵板或其他物品以免影響各項檢驗科目之準性，以防車主取巧。  現今為民國109年，其檢驗標準竟為63年7月30日第五次公路監理座談會第30項商定事項，以46年前商議事項作為檢驗標準實屬荒謬，且定期檢驗依檢驗員自由心證，監理單位之檢驗方式應與時俱進滾動式適時修正並訂定明確檢驗標準。
benefits&impact:
『道路交通安全規則』附件15 
車身 小型汽車固定式置放架 
1.應符合「車輛安全檢測基準」之「小型汽車置放架之靜態強度」規定。 
2.應安裝牢固，不得遮蔽號牌及燈光，不得突出車身兩側。 
3.如裝置於後方者，長度不得超過後側車身外五十公分，並以其完全展開狀態丈量。 
#建請修法以符民眾所需 
  
  
『道路交通安全規則』第77條第1項第10款 
小型汽車置放架，其使用應依下列規定： 
（一）置放架及裝載物應固定妥適。如裝置於車輛後側，其長度不應超過 
      後側車身外五十公分；如裝置於車頂，其含置放架之車輛全高應依 
      第三十八條第一項之規定。 
（二）置放架及裝載物不得遮蔽車輛之號牌與車輛後方燈光。 
 #建請修法以符民眾所需 
  
『道路交通安全規則』第2條第1項第16款 
車重：指車輛未載客貨及駕駛人之空車重量。 
『道路交通安全規則』第39之1 
汽車定期檢驗之檢驗項目及基準，包含以儀器檢測之腳煞車、手煞車效能、平衡度及前輪側滑度等須符合規定。 
#建請修法以符民眾所需
proposalEN: In recent years, outdoor leisure activities are popular. From passenger cars, SUVs, jeeps, trucks, etc., vehicles have completed the change of small car fixed racks in accordance with the provisions of "Road Traffic Safety Regulations" Annex 15. However, during regular inspections, the items on the racks that have been changed and noted (such as: roof tents, trunks (pans), retractable sunshades, etc.) must be removed before inspection. 0 agreed matters letter, the vehicle inspection should be based on the empty vehicle, and no iron plates or other items should be loaded so as not to affect the accuracy of various inspection subjects, so as to prevent the owner from taking advantage of it. Today is the 109th year of the Republic of China, and the inspection standard is the 30th item agreed upon at the 5th Highway Supervision Symposium on July 30, 1963. It is absurd to use the items discussed 46 years ago as the inspection standard, and regular inspections are based on the free will of the inspectors.
titleEN: The method of regular vehicle inspection has remained unchanged for 46 years, and the results are not true, and the inspectors are free to testify!

title: 國道ETC收歸國有，由民眾自主選擇付款方式
proposal: 國道電子收費系統於2025年屆期約滿時收歸國有，引進第三方多元支付平台，開放多元的支付方式給民眾自由選擇。
benefits&impact:
ETC收歸國有的好處： 
1.國道電子收費系統收費服務如同電力、水力等民生公用事業，收歸國有由國家經營，可避免單一財團壟斷。2.澳洲與加拿大在國道收費系統原本也是採取BOT方式，由民營企業進行承包，但在經營的合約到期後，收費系統之所有權即移轉給政府，而不是持續交給特定財團經營。3.未來的ETC在收歸國有後，可用交通部既有之車牌辨識技術，使民眾可以有多元選擇，不用侷限在「必須」安裝eTag的困擾。 
4.就長遠來看，引入多元第三方支付途徑，除可強化國家自主建立的台灣Pay市場佔有率，而多家的支付平台所提供的獨家方案或優惠更能使民眾受惠，達到政府、廠商、人民「三贏」局面。
proposalEN: The national highway electronic toll collection system will be nationalized when the contract expires in 2025, and a third-party multiple payment platform will be introduced to open up multiple payment methods for the public to choose freely.
titleEN: The national highway ETC is nationalized, and the public can choose the payment method independently

title: 我國應禁止餵養流浪動物
proposal: 寵物作為一種滿足人類精神需求的動物， 本來就只應存在於飼主的家中，不應流落到街上， 更遑論令其在外繁殖、建立野生族群， 這樣的結果就是導致壓迫甚至是改變既有的生態位， 有悖於保護自然生態的常理。 而造成流浪動物的最大原因就是棄養， 而目前最常見解決流浪動物的手段便是結紮， 但結紮不僅耗費大量人力物力，且根據研究， 結紮必須系統性地進行而不是單點式的，且結紮率需要到達75% 才能有效減少動物族群。 所以除了結紮，我想進一步希望政府明確禁止餵養流浪動物的行為， 因為在目前的結紮率下，流浪動物的族群本來就難以減少， 而餵養無疑是加劇了這樣的行為， 更何況目前常見的TNR也不包含餵食， 自以為善意的餵養，已使許多人為了解決流浪動物問題的努力付諸東流。且放任寵物在外游盪，也就是俗稱的放養， 已經不被現在的社會觀念認可， 也在動保法中明確規定禁止使寵物在外遊蕩。 既然放養引起的問題已經得到重視並修法解決， 我認為相同的概念也適用於餵養行為。 具體實行可以朝環保檢舉的方向進行， 餵食的碗盤食物甚至是貓砂等通常都放置在公共空間， 有潛在的環境衛生風險，且若是採以檢舉的方式， 可節省政府主動稽查的成本，且環保相關的檢舉會有檢舉獎金， 更進一步增加了檢舉者的誘因， 可期大量減少餵養流浪動物的不良行為。
benefits&impact:
目前流浪動物已導致包括但不限於以下的問題： 
1、    流浪貓狗突然衝出影響交通安全 民眾為了閃躲突然出現的動物，而導致失控自撞或撞人的情況時有所聞，導致財產甚至是生命安全的損失，同樣地使流浪貓狗持續地在街上生存也須面對同樣的問題 
2、    流浪狗群咬傷甚至是咬死民眾 流浪狗有群聚的天性，喜歡群體追捕獵物，老人小孩落單時偶有成為流浪狗群獵捕的案例。 
3、    流浪動物建立野生族群壓迫原生種 
4、    獵殺原生種，包括某些已適應都市的保育類動物 
5、    流浪貓狗造成環境髒亂的問題，如大小便、貓狗腳印等 
6、    流浪動物可能帶有潛在疾病風險，台灣目前仍是狂犬病疫區 
餵食行為如前文所述，會使減少流浪動物問題變得更加困難，故應禁止餵食的行為。最後，我想說沒有任何一個社會問題是只靠一條法律就能完全解決的，但不代表我們不能朝這方向努力。
proposalEN: As an animal that meets the spiritual needs of human beings, pets should only exist in the owner's home and should not be left on the street, let alone let them breed outside and establish wild populations. The biggest cause of stray animals is abandonment, and the most common solution to stray animals is neutering, but neutering not only consumes a lot of manpower and material resources, but also according to research, neutering must be done systematically rather than at a single point, and the neutering rate needs to reach 75% to effectively reduce animal populations. So in addition to neutering, I would like to further hope that the government will explicitly prohibit the behavior of feeding stray animals, because under the current neutering rate, the population of stray animals is difficult to reduce, and feeding will undoubtedly aggravate such behaviors, not to mention that the current common TNR does not include feeding. Feeding people who think they are good-hearted has made many people's efforts to solve the problem of stray animals go to waste. Moreover, allowing pets to roam outside, commonly known as free-range, is no longer recognized by current social concepts, and the Animal Protection Law clearly prohibits pets from roaming outside. Now that the problems caused by stocking have been addressed and amended, I think the same concepts apply to feeding behaviour. The specific implementation can be carried out in the direction of environmental protection reports. Feeding dishes and even cat litter are usually placed in public spaces, which has potential environmental health risks. If the method of reporting is adopted, it can save the cost of the government’s active inspection, and there will be rewards for reporting related to environmental protection, which further increases the incentives for whistleblowers. It is expected that the bad behavior of feeding stray animals will be greatly reduced.
titleEN: my country should ban feeding stray animals

title: 延長大專院校護理科因應嚴重特殊傳染性肺炎疫情之虛擬課程時數
proposal: 教育部於5月21日回覆有關醫事類科學生實習處理方式第2點提及「若疫情四級至二級時，各項實習課程仍照常進行」，公告之實習課程應變機制中，報考護理師類別之虛擬課程時數僅限51小時，迫使部分學校為考量學生考取證照之資格，而採取學生返校進行模擬教室之實習措施，無異與現行社會防疫需求逆行。 嚴重特殊傳染性肺炎疫情日益嚴峻，確診病例及死亡人數日漸攀升。多數學生與家長皆不願在此情況下增加群聚機會，且返校亦造成人群跨區移動，增加搭乘大眾運輸工具之人流，造成染疫風險增高，導致醫療量能緊繃。身為未來護理人員，不願造成疫情擴散之可能，故懇請教育部更改此決策，將虛擬課程時數調整至256小時，讓學生能如期完成高護實習，達到考照資格，且為防疫共盡心力。
benefits&impact:
高護實習如期完成，學生可達考照資格，不耽誤畢業時間。 
 校方無須安排後續補實習之課程，不影響其他各年級實習生之權益。 
 減少群聚機會及人流移動，降低染疫風險及疫情擴散之可能。
proposalEN: On May 21, the Ministry of Education responded to the second point of the handling method for medical students’ internships and mentioned that “if the epidemic is level 4 to level 2, all internship courses will still be carried out as usual.” In the contingency mechanism for internship courses announced, the number of hours of virtual courses for nurses is limited to 51 hours, forcing some schools to consider students’ qualifications for obtaining certificates. Students return to school for internships in simulated classrooms, which is tantamount to retrograde the current social epidemic prevention needs. The epidemic of severe special infectious pneumonia is becoming more and more serious, and the number of confirmed cases and deaths is increasing day by day. Most students and parents are unwilling to increase the chances of gathering in this situation, and returning to school will also cause people to move across districts, increasing the flow of people on public transportation, resulting in an increased risk of infection and straining medical capacity. As future nurses, I do not want to cause the possibility of the spread of the epidemic, so I implore the Ministry of Education to change this decision and adjust the virtual course hours to 256 hours, so that students can complete the high-level nursing practice as scheduled, qualify for the examination, and work together for epidemic prevention.
titleEN: Extension of virtual course hours for the nursing department of tertiary institutions in response to the severe epidemic of specific infectious pneumonia

title: 立法修改醫護人員應強制加入工會而非公會
proposal: 公會是立屬於學術團體故應是依各人意願加入，而不應強制加入
benefits&impact: 公會是立屬於學術團體故應是依各人意願加入，而不應強制加入，且醫護人員於醫療院所是屬於僱傭條件，故應是強制加入工會才對，因為工會對於醫護人員的工作權有所幫助，但公會則只屬於學術研究對於醫護人員的工作權全無幫助
proposalEN: The guild is an academic group, so it should be joined according to the wishes of each individual, and should not be forced to join
titleEN: Legislation changes healthcare workers to make it mandatory to join unions, not guilds

title: 嚴懲五萬名逃逸外勞，縮短逃逸造成的照護空窗期，將家庭看護納入衛福部，保障失能、失智者的受照護權及人權
proposal: 本案提議重點在於保障「失能者家庭」的「失能」、「失智」病人，合法聘僱家庭看護工卻沒有獲得保障，看護工常因「怠工」、「轉換雇主」、「違背工作契約」、「逃逸」等現象，造成家有「身心障礙者」的家庭嚴重失能。目前台灣逃逸的外勞在黑工市場工作人數多達5.2萬，不僅是「國家安全」問題，無法追蹤逃逸外勞去處，也造成逃逸歪風無法遏止，造成合法雇主、合法仲介、合法移工，受到非法市場的嚴重影響。本案提請積極處理外籍勞工逃逸與失聯問題，並進而提供罰則增加逃逸阻力，提案數個建議，但希望只要有其中一項是您認同的，就覆議，能讓相關單位，進行討論與改進。 台灣給外籍勞工的薪資，是亞洲最高(最少是前幾名)，加上給外籍勞工的健保等福利，在亞洲引進外籍勞工市場上是有競爭力的。但目前台灣的現在制度以保護外勞、不保障雇主為主軸。台灣每年累計逃逸、失聯外勞根據移民署統計為5.2萬人(2021)，台灣雇主遇到外勞惡意失聯、逃逸不僅申訴無門、毫無保障，權責機關亦往往無法查獲逃逸外勞，直到該失聯外勞自行投案。通常投案都是獲取足夠報酬、決定回國，才自行投案。根據「就業服務法」的規定，外籍勞工失聯，如果移工是家庭看護類型的話，雇主要等滿3個月；如果移工的工作是家庭看護以外的工作（例如家庭幫傭），雇主要等滿6個月，向勞動部申請遞補。暫且不論遞補人力的家庭幫傭或工廠移工，通常申請到家庭看護的家庭，是家裡需要有「病人」需要接受照護。當外勞無故失聯，通常更是惡意遺棄照顧者(受害者)，進行逃跑，懲罰「受害者」跟其家屬極不合理。讓這些需要照護人力的病人跟其家庭，已面臨外籍看護討厭後的損失，卻還得被懲罰三個月不能再申請遞補，甚至在某特定期限內失聯者，亦影響合法仲介的經營。但其實逃逸外勞眾多的問題根源不是出在聘僱者或仲介，而是出在外籍勞工、非法仲介、非法聘僱的雇主身上。因此，本案建議： 1、將工廠工及家庭看護工分開管理，並修法限制看護工轉廠工 僅由仲介業自發性避免讓家庭看護工轉成廠工，無相關法條規範並予以限制，造成家庭看護工在長照制度未完善前遞補的勞力缺口出現更大的不足。當工廠大老闆都來家有病人跟老人的雇主家中挖走家庭看護工，更會造成失能家庭更失能。此應將工廠雇主與有照護需求之雇主，分開討論。工廠老闆聘廠工乃為追求利潤，拿巴氏量表的家庭看護雇主，有照護需求，且醫療照護、受照護者的人權，亟需被重視。2021年1-6月，已有2000名家庭看護工，透過洗工的方式，轉到工廠，嚴重造成約2,000名受照護者頓時失去照護人力，影響2,000個家庭甚鉅! 2. 將家庭看護工納入衛福部管理，落實將外籍看護作為補足長照人力不足的方法 家庭看護工與雇主不是典型的勞資關係，家庭看護工（勞方）替老化、行動不變或功能障礙者（受照護者）提供勞務，而雇主往往為受照護者家人（資方）。家庭看護工問題所涉及的不是勞動部專責的勞動業務、勞資關係制度及事務，而是如何透過提供失能家庭持續性照護與社會資源協助，進而提升受照護者權益、保障身心障礙者、解決失能家庭照護問題。建議將有長期照護需求而聘僱的家庭看護工納入「衛生福利部長期照護司」管理，與廠工、漁工等商業行為下的雇傭關係類別移工做完全區隔，正視外籍家庭看護工為長期照護體系中無可取代的勞動人口，將其納入政策規劃，重新檢視外籍看護的工作轉換、照護技能，讓外籍看護工在有效管理制度中，成為長期照護體系下的一環，進而落實保障身心障礙者與老人的權益與人權 (張姮燕，2021)。 3. 增加線上舉報系統讓雇主12小時失聯即可線上或是App 通報移民署 雇主遇到直接進入通報系統，幫助警方或權責單位緝查。根據目前法失聯外勞，在失去聯繫、逃逸的第一到三天失聯期，可以第一次通報，接著再行等待三天通報再正式通報確認失聯。如此一來加上若遇國定例假日，逃逸日期將累積七天以上。台灣生活一日圈的便利下，三天時間太長。另若每三天聯繫雇主一次，即可規避失聯的通報，制度已出現漏洞，應予以解決。 4、廢止外籍勞工逃逸懲戒「家庭看護工」雇主三個月空窗期，無法遞補的規定 修正「就業服務法」規定外籍勞工失聯，限制雇主三個月不得再聘請遞補的限制，尤其是「照護病人」工作的家庭看護工部分。引進來照顧老弱病殘的勞動力，逃逸後，失能家庭，「空窗一天都是問題」，更何況是現有的三個月!又如現在新冠肺炎的疫情，引進外勞更困難，若最近逃逸的外勞仍舊有近兩千名，這其中又有一半是家庭看護工，亦即有一千個家庭，先得三個月不得申請遞補，得用各種方式來尋求照顧人力，接著再尋求國內移工(這個又是另一個大問題，因為缺工，不管多不適任的外勞都可以轉換)的幾個禮拜，再接著進行國外媒合。這樣總共最少會是半年的空窗期。 5、積極的取締逃逸外勞 目前市場逃逸外勞沒抓到的有52,000人次，這些人都在非法市場工作，會是社會問題、公共健康的隱憂，因為他們既沒健保，也沒工作證，但薪資較合法高，也影響到本勞的工作機會。每個外籍勞工到台灣工作，皆有手機。逃逸、失聯外勞，形同台灣非法勞工造成的社會安全破口。想像每年有五萬個不應該在台灣的外籍人士，違反法律的滯留在台，甚至非法工作。不用繳稅、沒有罰責，更造成像此次新冠肺炎非法看護或外勞造成的防疫破口，因此有必要「將社會安全設置在個人隱私之上」。建議規範每個外籍看護工在台工作，必須以其真實身分申請手機門號，必須是能追蹤其電話發話的系統，也能追蹤其行蹤，一旦發生逃逸跟失聯的狀況，再啟動其追蹤行蹤的功能。如同現在的細胞簡訊一樣，一般民眾或是公權力執行單位(如警察、移民署)附近出現逃逸、失聯外勞，手機APP 可以通知，並進行舉報。 6、外籍勞工失聯尋獲或其自首後，應面臨罰款、刑責 外籍勞工逃逸失聯，尤其是遺棄受照顧者之意圖及行為構成傷害者，應面臨罰款、刑責後方得遣送回國。故其工作期間不得將薪資悉數匯出台灣，避免外籍勞工到案後，皆以財務狀況為由規避所有該付之責任。此建議參考新加坡的規定，依照法規，其有非法工作、非法居留等違法事由，該移工必須面臨罰款、刑責後，方得遣送回國。並限制其未來再度來台工作之機會。 7、建立雇主回饋外籍勞工表現系統 若外勞不符合需求，或是有其他必須資遣的規定時，雇主送外傭回去後可以利用政府提供的回饋系統，而這回饋會送到各仲介以及外勞雇主上，未來有雇主都會看到這份回饋。建議若有不適任外籍勞工，在遣送回去後，此機制必須建立，作為雙向評估。當外籍勞工可以選擇更換雇主，雇主也必須有同樣的機制，保障自己。 8、雇主得停聘不合格之外籍勞工並將其遣送回國 當有外籍勞工威脅更換雇主、逃跑威脅仲介或雇主之事由時，得由權責單位偕同建立評估、輔導機制，若輔導失效，即由雇主進行下一個外傭的引進，並將不合格之外籍勞工遣送回國後，不得再來台工作。此可以保障雇主權利，並減少外籍勞工以逃跑作為解決方式的後果。 參考資料: 1. 張姮燕，2021，解洗工問題，將外籍看護納衛福部，蘋果日報：https://tw.appledaily.com/forum/20210208/SCWMM7UL6FBBVF7R4CAN7GJFVM/ 2. 新加坡外籍勞工管理制度 a. https://www.mom.gov.sg/passes-and-permits/work-permit-for-foreign-domestic-worker/notify-mom-of-changes ; b. https://www.mom.gov.sg/faq/work-permit-for-fdw/what-will-happen-to-my-missing-fdw-when-her-work-permit-is-cancelled
benefits&impact:
我國對外籍勞工的保障，已經限制住雇主許多權益。但無限上綱保障外籍勞工，會使得他們隨時可以逃逸(從失聯勞工數目可得知肯定有動機跟好的報酬促使他們成為非法)，也使得雇主在管理外籍勞工，非常困難。又比如我們奉公守法的雇主，也難抵非法仲介對外籍勞工的誘惑，以及供需不平衡造成外籍勞工逃逸的動機，完全沒有保障。 
因此，在聘僱前的資料送審期間不在此案討論之列，但聘僱後到離職前，尚可透過此案所提的機制，防止眾多逃逸、失聯外勞的案例。畢竟每年失聯外勞五萬名，並非小數目，也絕對是國家安全的破口。若這些移工發生健康問題、刑事案件，都將是台灣社會的重大負擔。 
另外，建立外勞不符合需求，或是有其他必須資遣的規定時的評估機制，可以保障優量雇主的權益。若雇主在外傭服務期滿或中途得中斷合約等條件構成後，外籍勞工回國或離職後可以利用政府提供的回饋系統，而這回饋會送到各仲介以及外勞雇主上，未來有雇主都會看到這份回饋。建議若有不適任外籍勞工，在遣送回去後，此機制必須建立，作為雙向評估。當外籍勞工可以選擇更換雇主，雇主也必須有同樣的機制，保障自己。 
當然更重要的是，此案提議能更積極有效的取締逃逸外勞，而非被動等逃逸外勞在路上被警方或權責單位查獲，或是等其獲利了結後自行投案。透過科技追蹤外籍勞工軌跡，自可防止非法居留、非法工作之違法行為，並在如此新冠肺炎的疫情時，亦可避免逃逸外勞的防疫破洞，畢竟每個外勞在台灣都有手機，不可能追蹤不到，要不要有所作為而已。國家安全、人民安全，與個人隱私應有所取決，而追蹤軌跡將只在違法事實發生後，由權責單位開啟。 
以上各提案，更建議政府相關制度不應以懲罰雇主和仲介為立意，大部分的雇主都是因為有具體需要才能引進外籍勞工來台，尤其是家庭看護工。當政府保障外籍勞工，極力倡導1995專線時，必須考量到雇主端的需求與保障。畢竟，雇主每個月繳交的就業安定基金，也為了聘僱外籍勞工造成台灣勞工就業市場緊縮作為彌補，但目前法規，都以保障外籍勞工為方向，實應予以修正。此提案將能保障優良雇主，不違法聘僱非法外勞等守法人民的權益。
proposer: 台灣失能者家庭暨看護雇主國際協會
proposalEN: 本案提議重點在於保障「失能者家庭」的「失能」、「失智」病人，合法聘僱家庭看護工卻沒有獲得保障，看護工常因「怠工」、「轉換雇主」、「違背工作契約」、「逃逸」等現象，造成家有「身心障礙者」的家庭嚴重失能。目前台灣逃逸的外勞在黑工市場工作人數多達5.2萬，不僅是「國家安全」問題，無法追蹤逃逸外勞去處，也造成逃逸歪風無法遏止，造成合法雇主、合法仲介、合法移工，受到非法市場的嚴重影響。本案提請積極處理外籍勞工逃逸與失聯問題，並進而提供罰則增加逃逸阻力，提案數個建議，但希望只要有其中一項是您認同的，就覆議，能讓相關單位，進行討論與改進。 台灣給外籍勞工的薪資，是亞洲最高(最少是前幾名)，加上給外籍勞工的健保等福利，在亞洲引進外籍勞工市場上是有競爭力的。但目前台灣的現在制度以保護外勞、不保障雇主為主軸。台灣每年累計逃逸、失聯外勞根據移民署統計為5.2萬人(2021)，台灣雇主遇到外勞惡意失聯、逃逸不僅申訴無門、毫無保障，權責機關亦往往無法查獲逃逸外勞，直到該失聯外勞自行投案。通常投案都是獲取足夠報酬、決定回國，才自行投案。根據「就業服務法」的規定，外籍勞工失聯，如果移工是家庭看護類型的話，雇主要等滿3個月；如果移工的工作是家庭看護以外的工作（例如家庭幫傭），雇主要等滿6個月，向勞動部申請遞補。暫且不論遞補人力的家庭幫傭或工廠移工，通常申請到家庭看護的家庭，是家裡需要有「病人」需要接受照護。當外勞無故失聯，通常更是惡意遺棄照顧者(受害者)，進行逃跑，懲罰「受害者」跟其家屬極不合理。讓這些需要照護人力的病人跟其家庭，已面臨外籍看護討厭後的損失，卻還得被懲罰三個月不能再申請遞補，甚至在某特定期限內失聯者，亦影響合法仲介的經營。但其實逃逸外勞眾多的問題根源不是出在聘僱者或仲介，而是出在外籍勞工、非法仲介、非法聘僱的雇主身上。因此，本案建議： 1、將工廠工及家庭看護工分開管理，並修法限制看護工轉廠工 僅由仲介業自發性避免讓家庭看護工轉成廠工，無相關法條規範並予以限制，造成家庭看護工在長照制度未完善前遞補的勞力缺口出現更大的不足。當工廠大老闆都來家有病人跟老人的雇主家中挖走家庭看護工，更會造成失能家庭更失能。此應將工廠雇主與有照護需求之雇主，分開討論。工廠老闆聘廠工乃為追求利潤，拿巴氏量表的家庭看護雇主，有照護需求，且醫療照護、受照護者的人權，亟需被重視。2021年1-6月，已有2000名家庭看護工，透過洗工的方式，轉到工廠，嚴重造成約2,000名受照護者頓時失去照護人力，影響2,000個家庭甚鉅! 2. 將家庭看護工納入衛福部管理，落實將外籍看護作為補足長照人力不足的方法 家庭看護工與雇主不是典型的勞資關係，家庭看護工（勞方）替老化、行動不變或功能障礙者（受照護者）提供勞務，而雇主往往為受照護者家人（資方）。家庭看護工問題所涉及的不是勞動部專責的勞動業務、勞資關係制度及事務，而是如何透過提供失能家庭持續性照護與社會資源協助，進而提升受照護者權益、保障身心障礙者、解決失能家庭照護問題。建議將有長期照護需求而聘僱的家庭看護工納入「衛生福利部長期照護司」管理，與廠工、漁工等商業行為下的雇傭關係類別移工做完全區隔，正視外籍家庭看護工為長期照護體系中無可取代的勞動人口，將其納入政策規劃，重新檢視外籍看護的工作轉換、照護技能，讓外籍看護工在有效管理制度中，成為長期照護體系下的一環，進而落實保障身心障礙者與老人的權益與人權 (張姮燕，2021)。 3. 增加線上舉報系統讓雇主12小時失聯即可線上或是App 通報移民署 雇主遇到直接進入通報系統，幫助警方或權責單位緝查。根據目前法失聯外勞，在失去聯繫、逃逸的第一到三天失聯期，可以第一次通報，接著再行等待三天通報再正式通報確認失聯。如此一來加上若遇國定例假日，逃逸日期將累積七天以上。台灣生活一日圈的便利下，三天時間太長。另若每三天聯繫雇主一次，即可規避失聯的通報，制度已出現漏洞，應予以解決。 4、廢止外籍勞工逃逸懲戒「家庭看護工」雇主三個月空窗期，無法遞補的規定 修正「就業服務法」規定外籍勞工失聯，限制雇主三個月不得再聘請遞補的限制，尤其是「照護病人」工作的家庭看護工部分。引進來照顧老弱病殘的勞動力，逃逸後，失能家庭，「空窗一天都是問題」，更何況是現有的三個月!又如現在新冠肺炎的疫情，引進外勞更困難，若最近逃逸的外勞仍舊有近兩千名，這其中又有一半是家庭看護工，亦即有一千個家庭，先得三個月不得申請遞補，得用各種方式來尋求照顧人力，接著再尋求國內移工(這個又是另一個大問題，因為缺工，不管多不適任的外勞都可以轉換)的幾個禮拜，再接著進行國外媒合。這樣總共最少會是半年的空窗期。 5、積極的取締逃逸外勞 目前市場逃逸外勞沒抓到的有52,000人次，這些人都在非法市場工作，會是社會問題、公共健康的隱憂，因為他們既沒健保，也沒工作證，但薪資較合法高，也影響到本勞的工作機會。每個外籍勞工到台灣工作，皆有手機。逃逸、失聯外勞，形同台灣非法勞工造成的社會安全破口。想像每年有五萬個不應該在台灣的外籍人士，違反法律的滯留在台，甚至非法工作。不用繳稅、沒有罰責，更造成像此次新冠肺炎非法看護或外勞造成的防疫破口，因此有必要「將社會安全設置在個人隱私之上」。建議規範每個外籍看護工在台工作，必須以其真實身分申請手機門號，必須是能追蹤其電話發話的系統，也能追蹤其行蹤，一旦發生逃逸跟失聯的狀況，再啟動其追蹤行蹤的功能。如同現在的細胞簡訊一樣，一般民眾或是公權力執行單位(如警察、移民署)附近出現逃逸、失聯外勞，手機APP title: 防疫期間，請停止對海外國人「出境超過2年，遷出戶籍」限制！
proposal: 我是旅居日本已經30年以上的台灣國民（唯一的國籍是台灣）。生活的重心雖然在日本，但是每年都會往返台灣數次。不只一直有在盡國民應盡的義務：繳國民健保、年金跟所得稅等，每次投票更是不會缺席。 最近知悉，出境超過2年戶籍會被遷出的規定。雖然根據內政部的公告，只要不超過4年，回國後立即可以恢復戶籍跟健保等，還有因為110年（2021年）沒有選舉所以不影響投票的權益等等。但是，明年不一樣，明年有縣市長跟縣市議員的選舉，如果我們的戶籍被遷出了，豈是「立即恢復」可以解決的！根據選罷法的規定地方性的選舉，必需在當地設籍6個月以上！ 很多跟我一樣關心台灣的海外國人回國參與了2020的總統大選跟公投。也就是說我們會在2022年1月面臨上述的「超過2年」。以我個人為例，我自己最後一次離開台灣是在總統大選的隔天2020/1/12。如果我想參與明年的縣市長投票，照現在的防疫規定，我得在2022/1/11之前回國一趟，隔離14天後的隔天回到日本，然後另外在縣市長投票前22天（14天+自主7天）再度回到台灣，才會有投票權。更不要說健保、年金停止期間也會損及我們的權益。如果我們在被停止的這段期間內在國外染疫或死了，就不算了嗎？ 目前全球的疫情狀況，越是關心台灣的海外國人，越不願意冒著把病毒帶回家鄉或讓自己在旅途上染疫的險回國（也因為克制自己不要回國，才會有「有可能超過2年」的問題）。在加上我國現行的防疫規定，除了因飛機的減班、事前事後的PCR檢測、防疫旅館等而暴增的旅費之外，長達14天的隔離更讓很多人難以成行，造成了不是我們不回國，是我們回不去「有家歸不得」的苦境。 呼籲相關單位正視我們的困境。不是要修法，更不是要打擾防疫工作，而是只要能在防疫規定中增設類是「防疫期間停止計算不在國內期間的限制等的除外條款」海外的我們就可以解套了。 懇請大家幫忙連署，感謝！感謝！
benefits&impact: 基於出境超過2年會被遷出戶籍以及選罷法對於地方性選舉必需在當地設籍6個月以上的規定，可能造成因為配合COVID-19疫情的國境管制措施，無法在2年之內回到國內的海外國人，喪失2022年的縣市長及地方民代選舉的投票權。
proposalEN: I am a Taiwanese national who has lived in Japan for more than 30 years (the only nationality is Taiwan). Although the focus of my life is in Japan, I travel to and from Taiwan several times a year. Not only has he been fulfilling the obligations of citizens: paying national health insurance, annuity and income tax, etc., he will not be absent every time he votes. Recently, I learned that if you leave the country for more than 2 years, your household registration will be moved out. Although according to the announcement of the Ministry of the Interior, as long as it does not exceed 4 years, household registration and health insurance can be restored immediately after returning to China, and because there is no election in 110 years (2021), it will not affect the right to vote, etc. However, next year will be different. Next year there will be elections for county mayors and county and city councilors. If our household registration is moved out, how can it be solved by "immediate restoration"! According to the provisions of the Election and Strike Law, for local elections, it is necessary to register in the local area for more than 6 months! Many overseas Chinese who care about Taiwan like me have returned to China to participate in the 2020 presidential election and referendum. In other words, we will face the above-mentioned "more than 2 years" in January 2022. Taking me personally as an example, the last time I left Taiwan was on 1/12/2020, the day after the presidential election. If I want to participate in the county mayor vote next year, according to the current epidemic prevention regulations, I have to go back to China before 2022/1/11, return to Japan the next day after 14 days of quarantine, and then return to Taiwan 22 days before the county mayor vote (14 days + 7 days of independence) before I have the right to vote. Not to mention that the suspension of health insurance and annuity will also damage our rights and interests. If we get sick or die abroad during the period of suspension, doesn't it count? The more concerned about the current global epidemic situation, the more foreigners overseas in Taiwan are, the less willing they are to take the risk of bringing the virus back to their hometown or catching the disease on their journey back to China (it is also because they restrain themselves from returning to China that there is a problem of "maybe more than 2 years"). In addition to the current anti-epidemic regulations in our country, in addition to the sharp increase in travel expenses due to reduced flight schedules, pre- and post-event PCR tests, and anti-epidemic hotels, the 14-day quarantine has made it difficult for many people to travel. Call on relevant units to face up to our plight. It is not to amend the law, let alone disturb the epidemic prevention work, but as long as we can add an exception clause in the epidemic prevention regulations, such as "stop counting restrictions on non-domestic period during the epidemic prevention period", we can solve the problem overseas. I implore everyone to help sign, thank you! grateful!
titleEN: During the epidemic prevention period, please stop the restrictions on foreigners who have left the country for more than 2 years and moved out of their household registration!

title: 請交通部開設「交通疫情指揮中心」 舉辦記者會 詳報交通傷亡數字原因並接受提問
proposal: 立院交通委員會限縮檢舉樣態之後毫無配套措施，非解決問題而解決「提出問題的人」。目前我國每年超過3,000人死於交通事故，近50萬人受傷，今年2021年1~7月也已經有1,709人在道路喪命，這個數字將近COVID-19疫情死亡人數的4倍，是太魯閣事故死亡人數的61倍。數十年來交通疫情已在各縣市間蔓延，造成重大傷亡卻無人重視，這就是「系統性交通暴力」。 在此提案請交通部長主持跨部會會議，每周開設【交通疫情指揮中心】記者會，例如每周三11:00開會報數字，有權責，釐清我國每周A1、A2事故數量、原因、解決方案，在場有問必答，落實透明政府。 之所以提案依據下列幾個原因： 【縣市政府群魔亂舞】交通標線設計、動線規劃、指標告示，在我國各縣市都是亂七八糟，紅線？黃線？白線？停車格？ 里長、市議員可以因為地方需求，任意機車畫汽車，紅線畫白線，還可以單行道改雙向，專業的技師以及交通工程的專業意見，不需要也不用被採納。中央內政部營建署空有各種精美的道路設計手冊、人本交通手冊，就是沒人看，因為叫做「手冊」完全無強制力，地方各自為政，全台標準不一。例如在台南市新化菜市場的違規停車路中央，先是被檢舉，結果地方勢力就地合法在路中間劃設停車格，最後被監察院發函才撤除，這就是沒有明確法源之下，地方政府或是地方勢力可以無限把「公共利益」、「人本交通」當作政治提款機。所以要有法源，各縣市政府執行才有依據。 各位能夠想像嗎，要是酒駕的標準各縣市不一樣，這國家會怎樣？  【事故死因不明】有立委也在立院要求蘇貞昌院長，要求定期公布傷亡人數與原因分析。假設交通安全是個人，此人死因是需要公開的，許多的新聞對事故報導，都點點到為止，很多新聞的最後一句話「肇事原因由警方進一步鑑識調查釐清」就很諷刺，因為實際上不會公開，因為媒體不追、民代不追，這鑑識報告就會被埋在茫茫人海裡，沒有後續。所以無論天災、人禍、標線設計、司機撿打火機、過勞等各種原因，你不知道、我不知道，還有獨眼龍也不知道。除非除非重大傷亡家屬追究、或是撞到名人才會有人出來解釋。 所以發生事故的原因無人知道，解方如何對症下藥？  【公共運輸死角】孕婦、長輩、小孩，敢獨自搭公車嗎？一上車就車輛就起步，不等定位，但官員在電視上說會增加扶手數量，可是瑞凡，還沒握到桿子就重力加速度了好嗎？台北市每年有兩百個人跌倒。過站不停、夾人、辱罵乘客、睡覺、滑手機、輪胎掉、脫班...層出不窮。自己的公車自己救，公車一旦腐爛可憐的是過勞的司機跟公車族，最弱勢的老人、兒童、身障朋友。公共運輸每年吸交通部的多少奶水，各種補助，台北市公車一年46億，北北桃一年的公車補助預算超過百億以上，北市第三劑疫苗也才編列28億，你各位不心痛嗎？這麼多錢怎麼會有如此CP值？那是因為公車集團化經營，地方議會監督力軟落，你好大我好怕。 所以公運各種事故的原因、過勞、公運基礎設施的缺失，都必須要完全公開，勿枉勿縱。
benefits&impact:
利益： 
  
小朋友可以自己上學不用開車載，不用因為害怕危險交通而不敢走路上學、不敢搭會夾人的公車 
交通更安全、公共運輸更安全 
工程、執法、教育 都可以因為記者會的公開透明而整合 
紅線白線不會再亂畫了 
議員要敲掉人行道讓車流不再發生 還我人行道 
警察會開始執法 人民不因為警員不執法而互相對立 
  
影響： 
  
1. 有政府、會做事，讓各部會可以一起動起來，不然都各玩各的鳥。無所用心。 
2. 知道問題在哪裡地點，因為公開錯誤道路設計地點，公開沒有執法的路段，才可以面對問題來解決問題。  
3. 有警察，會執法，徹底解決步行者地獄的國際汙名，也解決了人民與人民之間的追打、私刑、馬桶爆炸等等對立。 
  
【延伸閱讀】 
  
台灣需要一場終結系統性交通暴力的交通革命 
運將對老人破口咆哮，背後是「免洗筷司機」經營模式的惡性循環 
作家描寫時代，時代殺死作家——國定交通安全月的崩毀 
｜為什麼你該停讓行人？｜真的有行人帝王條款存在？｜行人地獄是如何被建構出來的？ 
與提案人聯繫
proposalEN: The Transportation Committee of the Legislative Yuan has no supporting measures after narrowing down the reports. Instead of solving the problem, it solves the "person who raised the problem." At present, more than 3,000 people die in traffic accidents every year in my country, and nearly 500,000 people are injured. From January to July this year, 1,709 people died on the roads. This figure is nearly four times the death toll from the COVID-19 epidemic and 61 times the death toll in the Taroko accident. For decades, the traffic epidemic has spread among counties and cities, causing heavy casualties but neglected. This is "systematic traffic violence." In this proposal, the Minister of Transportation is requested to preside over the inter-ministerial meeting and set up a press conference of the [Traffic Epidemic Command Center] every week. For example, the meeting will be held at 11:00 every Wednesday to report the figures. The reason for the proposal is based on the following reasons: [County and city governments are dancing with demons] Traffic line design, moving line planning, and indicator notices are in a mess in all counties and cities in my country. Red lines? yellow line? White line? Parking space? Mayors and city councilors can draw cars on arbitrary locomotives, draw white lines on red lines, and change one-way streets to two-way streets because of local needs. Professional technicians and professional opinions on traffic engineering are not needed and need not be adopted. The Construction Department of the Central Ministry of the Interior has all kinds of exquisite road design manuals and human-oriented traffic manuals, but no one reads them, because they are called "manuals" and they are completely non-compulsive. For example, in the center of the illegal parking road at the Xinhua Vegetable Market in Tainan City, it was first reported. As a result, local forces legally set up parking spaces in the middle of the road, and finally the Overwatch Council issued a letter to remove them. This means that without a clear source of law, local governments or local forces can infinitely use "public interests" and "people-oriented transportation" as political cash machines. Therefore, there must be a source of law for the county and city governments to implement. Can you imagine, if the standards for drunk driving are different in different counties and cities, what will happen to this country? [The cause of death in the accident is unknown] Some legislators also asked President Su Zhenchang in the Legislative Yuan to regularly announce the number of casualties and the cause analysis. Assuming that traffic safety is an individual, the cause of death of this person needs to be made public. Many news reports on the accident stop at the end. The last sentence of many news, "The cause of the accident will be clarified by further forensic investigation by the police" is ironic, because in fact it will not be made public, because the media does not pursue it, and the forensic report will be buried in the vast sea of ​​people without follow-up. Therefore, regardless of natural disasters, man-made disasters, marking design, drivers picking up lighters, overwork and other reasons, you don't know, I don't know, and neither do Cyclops. No one will come out to explain unless the family members of the major casualties pursue it, or hit a celebrity. So no one knows the cause of the accident, how to prescribe the right medicine for the solution? [Public transport blind spot] Pregnant women, elders, and children, dare to take the bus alone? As soon as you get on the car, the car will start without waiting for the positioning, but the official said on TV that the number of handrails will be increased, but Rui Fan, the acceleration of gravity has not been held by the poles, okay? In Taipei City, 200 people fall each year. Passing stops, pinching people, insulting passengers, sleeping, slipping mobile phones, falling tires, leaving shifts... the list goes on and on. Save your own bus by yourself. Once the bus rots, it will be the overworked drivers and bus owners, the most vulnerable elderly, children, and disabled friends. How much milk does public transportation receive from the Ministry of Communications every year, and various subsidies, Taipei City’s bus subsidies are 4.6 billion a year, Beibeitao’s annual bus subsidy budget is more than 10 billion, and the third dose of vaccines in Beishi is only allocated 2.8 billion. Don’t you feel sad? How can so much money have such a CP value? That's because the bus group is operated and the supervision of the local council is weak. You are so big and I am afraid. Therefore, the causes of various accidents in public transport, overwork, and lack of public transport infrastructure must be fully disclosed.
titleEN: Request the Ministry of Communications to set up a "Traffic Epidemic Command Center" and hold a press conference to report in detail the causes of traffic casualties and accept questions

title: 拯救台灣特有罕病FAP，呼籲加速FAP罕藥健保給付
proposal: 「家族性澱粉樣多發性神經病變」（FAP）為罕見遺傳疾病，以男性居多，平均在50歲發病，此時，正值職場高峰，不少人擔任主管要職，但幾年之間，風雲變色，人生從彩色變成黑白。 許多FAP病友為家庭經濟支柱，卻因多重系統病變異常，導致肢體殘障，行動不便，甚至腦出血、失智、癲癇、精神疾病，反倒成為家人沉重負擔，許多家庭為此陷入絕境。 在台灣，目前有138位確診的病患，估計至少近100個家族帶有FAP遺傳基因，若沒有妥善治療，病友於四、五年內就可能不良於行，被迫離開職場，且需長期臥床，仰賴家人照顧。 過去，這群FAP病友無藥可救，直到去年國內引進的新藥，臨床研究證實可有效延緩疾病惡化，才讓許多病友燃起一線希望。 不過，相較於美國、歐洲各國、加拿大、日本、愛爾蘭與巴西等國家已陸續將FAP用藥納入給付，國內步伐緩慢，眾多病友深感絕望，尤其正在接受臨床試驗的患者更是焦急，因用藥後，狀況穩定。一旦中斷治療，病情可能在幾個月內急轉而下。 病友是生病了，但病友還有機會支持家庭的生計，也還有機會避免成為社會的負擔。我們都知道，健保經費有限，極為珍貴，理當用在刀口上，「家族性澱粉樣多發性神經病變」病友如能接受新藥治療，就可持續在工作崗位上努力不懈，發揮所長，不致成為家庭及社會的沉重負擔。 期盼民眾發揮愛心，協助連署此項提議，不讓罕見疾病擊潰罕見病友及其家屬。  主要請求：籲請中央主管機關落實罕見疾病防治及藥物法第1條之1與第 34-1條的規定，協助罕見疾病病人，需用罕見疾病適用藥物之緊急取得。 一、正視目前「家族性澱粉樣多發性神經病變」罕病有國內核可的藥品，但無任一藥品被給付的事實，加速「家族性澱粉樣多發性神經病變」罕藥健保給付。 二、指派單一窗口，協助「家族性澱粉樣多發性神經病變」病友在健保給付前藥物之緊急取得。
benefits&impact:
一、「家族性澱粉樣多發性神經病變」病友能在藥物治療下，以延緩疾病惡化速度，繼續在職場工作。降低國家社會在長照上的負擔。 
二、「家族性澱粉樣多發性神經病變」病友病友能盡在藥物治療下，延緩神經病變以及降低心臟、腎臟等重要器官病變風險，進一步減少健保財務負擔。 
三、落實罕見疾病防治及藥物法，持續維護罕病病患權益，以及台灣在罕病照護上的國際領先地位。
proposalEN: "Family amyloid polyneuropathy" (FAP) is a rare genetic disease, mostly males, with an average onset at the age of 50. At this time, it is at the peak of the workplace, and many people hold important positions of management. However, within a few years, the situation has changed, and life has changed from color to black and white. Many FAP patients are the breadwinners of their families, but due to abnormalities in multiple systems, they lead to physical disabilities, mobility difficulties, and even cerebral hemorrhage, dementia, epilepsy, and mental illness. Instead, they become a heavy burden on their families, and many families are desperate for this. In Taiwan, there are currently 138 confirmed patients, and it is estimated that at least nearly 100 families carry the FAP gene. Without proper treatment, patients may become ill within four to five years, be forced to leave the workplace, and need to stay in bed for a long time, relying on family care. In the past, there was no cure for this group of FAP patients. It was not until last year when a new drug was introduced in China that clinical studies proved that it could effectively delay the progression of the disease, giving many patients a glimmer of hope. However, compared to the United States, European countries, Canada, Japan, Ireland, Brazil and other countries that have gradually included FAP medication in their benefits, the domestic pace is slow, and many patients feel hopeless, especially those who are undergoing clinical trials. Once treatment is discontinued, the condition may deteriorate rapidly within a few months. The patient is sick, but the patient still has the opportunity to support the livelihood of the family, and also has the opportunity to avoid becoming a burden on the society. We all know that health insurance funds are limited and extremely precious, and should be used on the knife edge. If patients with "familial amyloid polyneuropathy" can receive new drug treatment, they can continue to work hard at work and give full play to their strengths, so as not to become a heavy burden on their families and society. It is hoped that the public will show their love and help to sign this proposal, so that rare diseases will not overwhelm rare patients and their families. Main request: call on the central competent authority to implement Article 1-1 and Article 34-1 of the Rare Disease Prevention and Drug Act, and assist patients with rare diseases to urgently obtain drugs suitable for rare diseases. 1. Face up to the fact that there are domestically approved drugs for the rare disease of "familial amyloid polyneuropathy", but none of the drugs are paid, and accelerate the payment of rare drug health insurance for "familial amyloid polyneuropathy". 2. Designate a single window to assist patients with "familial amyloid polyneuropathy" in urgently obtaining drugs before health insurance benefits.
titleEN: Save Taiwan's unique rare disease FAP, calling for accelerated payment of FAP rare drug health insurance
